Author: huhu_matcha
Content: This is what some VCs and startup incubators/accelerators do in Aus

Author: huhu_matcha
Content: They provide the funding for a team to create a SaaS product and then it gets bought by a bigger company

Author: huhu_matcha
Content:
This is why large banks in Aus (there‚Äôs only 4 major banks here) have a business unit/arm focused on being a VC - mainly on SaaS fintech products. When that product gets released and makes revenue, eventually the large bank buys the startup and integrates it within its wider ecosystem.

For example: BCA creates a BCAx arm that behaves like a VC. They invest in smaller SaaS FinTechs. When those FinTechs become profitable, BCA then buys them to integrate into its portfolio.

Author: revwuzhere
Content:
so its like, the bank doesnt really risk any of research loss and tech failure because the new technology is has been credible enough to get integrated

the bank got new tech, and the startup get portion of the profit. nice

Author: huhu_matcha
Content:
Here‚Äôs an example of a VC that builds SaaS for startups. They partner with industry experts so that the SaaS that they build for a startup achieves better success of a Product Market Fit.

https://www.mayflyventures.com/

Author: huhu_matcha
Content: They use no-code tools to build a prototype, release it and then build a more robust version based on feedback

Author: huhu_matcha
Content: This means it‚Äôs less risky for startups. You don‚Äôt need to spend $$$ on hiring engineers up front.

Author: huhu_matcha
Content: You don‚Äôt need to be creative to look for an idea. VC or PE both are like gambling

Author: huhu_matcha
Content: Why I say you need to focus on 1 target market is because you need some domain knowledge

Author: huhu_matcha
Content: For example, I can see through EdTech pitches because I used to work in that sector. Do I know everything about it? No. But I can certainly ask questions to vet startups

Author: huhu_matcha
Content: One of the things I love to do in Aus is attend startup pitches and demos. You learn a lot about how the game works

Author: huhu_matcha
Content: The other thing is learning about how to become an angel investor.. what are the due diligence questions you need to ask

Author: huhu_matcha
Content: Remember that whether you‚Äôre a VC or a PE, you still need to vet ideas/companies

Author: mazeltof404
Content: Telkom MDI, Alpha JWC. There are plenty of VCs out there, or if you‚Äôre well connected bisa ke private credit (not your typical bank)

Author: mazeltof404
Content:
Befriend the biz student, tech bros, and stem kids, and the lawyers. Skenanya kalo di US biasa ada fireside chat, or kampus ada wing khusus funding startup. UCLA, Standford and UW for example ada vc group di kampus yg held competition proposal startup dan kasih seed funding.

Im not really sure buat skena di Indo, but at least di UGM dlu BRI ada BRI UMKM centre di sagan, dan biasa ada meeting rutin buat bridging umkm/startup sama vc or seminar pelatihan

Author: mazeltof404
Content: Starting a PE that focuses on acquiring tech juga aga susah since you either gotta have some experience in the financial industry (IB) or well connected ke LPs. Starting a tech startup entry barriernya ga stinggi establishing your own PE.

Author: petrachristalbert
Content:
while Huhuhaha giving advice of focusing on network, my advice is to target an unadvance audience. 

Software thing is an advance solution that require program etc. and u'd better focus on simple thing first while building experience and connection. (since u arent experienced on code and lack of budget).

Business Idea is a good thing. Try and error is normal thing. But u'd better ready for the critical situation by proper plan.

The point is, 'start simple, software isnt ur start line. Try developing a small business by offline or whatsapp, and make it perfect time by time. Learn from mistake, make SOP or Procedure, qualification, related law, and connection to costumer and affiliation. Once everything prepared, then u ready to turn your business into a software.'

Feel free to discuss things with me, I am down for every tech related conversation or things around that.

@Yoska ( Your Mughal Vizier )
